'Sachin Tendulkar didn't have personal bodyguard travelling': Indian cricket culture compared to ‘mainstream Bollywood’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Comparison of Indian Cricket Culture to Mainstream Bollywood by Sanjay Manjrekar

Date: Jan 18, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Former Indian cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar commented on the evolving culture of Indian cricket, suggesting it mirrors mainstream Bollywood. His remarks were in response to the BCCI's new guidelines mandating players to engage in domestic cricket and restricting family travel during tours.

  • The BCCI issued a 10-point dossier for centrally contracted players.
  • Guidelines include mandatory participation in domestic cricket.
  • Restrictions on family travel and personal staff such as bodyguards and chefs have been imposed.
  • Manjrekar critiqued the timing of these restrictions following series defeats.
  • He cited Sachin Tendulkar's lack of personal bodyguards as indicative of past cricket culture.
“Sachin Tendulkar was a huge star in our days. He didn't have a personal bodyguard travelling with the team.” - Sanjay Manjrekar

In conclusion, Manjrekar emphasizes the need for the cricket culture to remain focused on sport rather than the trappings associated with fame.
newTitle: Comparison of Indian Cricket Culture to Mainstream Bollywood by Sanjay Manjrekar

Karun Nair, 33, has established himself as a leading contender for India's Champions Trophy squad after remarkable performances in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. His average of 752 and five centuries have put him back in the spotlight.

  • WV Raman believes Nair should be a starter if selected, emphasizing his experience.

“#KarunNair is not in his teens to be in the reserves and watched by the team management. If he is picked, he plays given the form he is in, or if there is no slot for him, he should not be picked,” WV Raman mentioned.

Karun Nair continues to impress with record-breaking runs and aims to re-establish himself in the national team.
